title: What are different types of research papers and journal articles? - Quora

response.answer_text: In a typical peer-reviewed journal, the types of articles would be: regular research papers;short communications / rapid communications (typically just a few pages long in the final layout; often without abstract; upper limit on the number of words in the manuscript; sometimes published faster than a regular research paper);review articles;erratum/corrigendum (authors’ correction to their previously published article);discussion (another scientist provides feedback on a paper recently published in this journal; typically short; there is usually a deadline for submitting discussions, e.g. 2–3 months after publication of the original paper; some journals do not accept discussion articles);authors’ reply to discussion.Some journals do not provide the “short communication” option. Some (though very few) publish only papers of a fixed length (e.g. all papers must be 4 pages long in the final layout). Some journals do not accept review papers, while others encourage submission of reviews or publish exclusively reviews. When it comes to review articles, there is great variability, too. Some have only text, others contain a lot of figures, some are short (10–15 pages), others are much longer. When I see a review article, I usually look first at the list of references rather than at the page count. A sufficiently long list of references without any obvious bias might be a much better indication of a thorough review than the page count is. As you see, there is indeed a great variation, but the above covers the most, I think.

Types of Research paper Usually, there are so many types of the research paper, some of them are: Argumentative research papers In the argumentative research paper, the writer gives the introduction of the topic. With the help of this introduction part, the audience/readers can quickly know what is in the paper. In this, the writer informs the readers about the topic, and it is like the thesis statements. Analytical research paper The analytical research paper is a part of the work, which gives an informal analysis of the topic. And in the analytical research paper, the writer explores the topic, generally in the form of a question. Definition research paper The definition research paper is one of the common types of paper. It expects you to give just exposed target contentions and realities without utilizing closely-held conviction. It is the most educational sort of content. Despite the fact that definition papers incorporate realities from various sources, such kinds of scholastic papers just mirror the discoveries of different examines. Compare and contrast As its name tells that it compares something, in this one is required to examine the differences between two different authors, two subjects, etc. Cause and effect These compositions are normally used to track the assumed result from some action, logically, that must be clear to the reader. And also, this method is used for the education and business fields. Interpretive paper An interpretive paper is used for social science and literature. In the interpretive paper, students uses the knowledge which is gained from a particular case study.
